intro: Eriocaulon obclavatum, commonly known as the narrow-clawed flat sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually greenish or brownish and lack showy petals, typical of many sedges. Eriocaulon obclavatum plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various microorganisms and small invertebrates.
